intro: Lobostemon microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many other bellflowers. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking shade-tolerant plants.
